20/* Id */
21
22#ifndef ISC_OFFSET_H
23#define ISC_OFFSET_H 1
24
25/*! \file
26 * \brief
27 * File offsets are operating-system dependent.
28 */
29#include <limits.h> /* Required for CHAR_BIT. */
30#include <sys/types.h>
31#include <stddef.h> /* For Linux Standard Base. */
32
33typedef off_t isc_offset_t;
34
35/*%
36 * POSIX says "Additionally, blkcnt_t and off_t are extended signed integral
37 * types", so the maximum value is all 1s except for the high bit.
38 * This definition is more complex than it really needs to be because it was
39 * crafted to keep both the SunOS 5.6 and the HP/UX 11 compilers quiet about
40 * integer overflow. For example, though this is equivalent to just left
41 * shifting 1 to the high bit and then inverting the bits, the SunOS compiler
42 * is unhappy about shifting a positive "1" to negative in a signed integer.
43 */
44#define ISC_OFFSET_MAXIMUM \
45 (~(((off_t)-1 >> (sizeof(off_t) * CHAR_BIT - 1)) \
46 << (sizeof(off_t) * CHAR_BIT - 1)))
47
48#endif /* ISC_OFFSET_H */
49
